body_html:
Note that you can fix this AND preserve constexpr, see https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8016780/undefined-reference-to-static-constexpr-char

So, putting a declaration for the static constexpr in the cpp file would solve the problem. As would upgrading to C++17. And also as would, as is done here, deleting the constexpr.

If we're outlawing static constexpr, we should set up a lint rule to reject it.
body_text:
Note that you can fix this AND preserve constexpr, see https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8016780/undefined-reference-to-static-constexpr-char
So, putting a declaration for the static constexpr in the cpp file would solve the problem. As would upgrading to C++17. And also as would, as is done here, deleting the constexpr.
If we're outlawing static constexpr, we should set up a lint rule to reject it.
body:
Note that you can fix this AND preserve constexpr, see https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8016780/undefined-reference-to-static-constexpr-char

So, putting a declaration for the static constexpr in the cpp file would solve the problem. As would upgrading to C++17. And also as would, as is done here, deleting the constexpr.

If we're outlawing `static constexpr`, we should set up a lint rule to reject it.
